IE is still not able to handle text-shadow css. We should implement a fallback like implemented in [1]. The author uses the copy, blur, alpha hack. A second way is to use shadow filter. This way needs a tricky computing of ages and strength from offset-x and offset-y. If strength is bigger than 5px, ugly fading lines will be showen. The only benefit here is, that no dom element has to be copied.
Another big point is the feature detection: IE applies style properties even if it has no effect. So at the moment its enough to check for the filter style on IE. But since IE 10 can handle both css styles the feature detection must be extended.
[1] https://github.com/heygrady/textshadow/blob/master/jquery.textshadow.js
